meanings.definition: Feeling or showing a lack of hope or happiness
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the sky looked gloomiest with dark clouds covering the sun.
meanings.sent2: She always felt gloomiest on rainy days when the sun refused to shine.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, his attempts to cheer up the gloomiest cat in the shelter were in vain.
meanings.sent4: The gloomiest thoughts crept into her mind like shadows in the night, casting doubt on everything.
meanings.sent5: The gloomiest room in the house had no windows, making it feel like a cave of sadness.

meanings.sent1: The forest became gloomiest as the sun set behind the tall trees.
meanings.sent2: The alley was the gloomiest place in town, with no streetlights to brighten it up.
meanings.sent3: The detective searched the gloomiest corners of the old mansion for clues to the mystery.
meanings.sent4: In the gloomiest part of the cave, the light barely reached, creating eerie shadows on the walls.
meanings.sent5: The gloomiest painting in the gallery depicted a haunted house under a full moon.

meanings.sent1: The gloomiest painting in the collection was a dull landscape of a gray sky.
meanings.sent2: Her outfit was the gloomiest at the party, with no vibrant colors to be seen.
meanings.sent3: The gloomiest flower in the garden was a wilting, pale rose among the vibrant blooms.
meanings.sent4: The gloomiest day of the year was when the sky was a flat, featureless gray.
meanings.sent5: The gloomiest photo in the album captured a faded memory of a distant, colorless past.
